member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.HttpAgent
member.summary: An `IAgent` implementation using HTTP to make requests to the IC

member.name: P:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.HttpAgent.Identity
member.summary: The identity that will be used on each request unless overriden This identity can be anonymous

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.HttpAgent.#ctor(EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.Http.IHttpClient,EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Identities.IIdentity)
member.param: Optional. Identity to use for each request. If unspecified, will use anonymous identity
Optional. Sets the http client to use, otherwise will use the default http client

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.HttpAgent.#ctor(EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Identities.IIdentity,System.Uri)
member.param: Optional. Identity to use for each request. If unspecified, will use anonymous identity
Url to the boundry node to connect to. Defaults to `https://ic0.app/`

member.summary: The default http client to use with the built in `HttpClient`

member.summary: Default constructor
member.param: HTTP client to use

member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.Http.IHttpClient
member.summary: A simple http request interface for sending messages

member.summary: Sends a GET http request and awaits the response

member.returns: The http response

member.summary: Sends a POST http request and awaits a response

The CBOR encoded body to send
member.returns: The http response

member.summary: A model holding the HTTP response info

member.summary: Default constructor

A func that returns the http response content

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.Http.HttpResponse.GetContentAsync
member.summary: Returns the response content bytes

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.Http.HttpResponse.ThrowIfErrorAsync
member.summary: Throws an exception if the status code is not 200-299, otherwise does nothing

member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.IAgent
member.summary: An agent is used to communicate with the Internet Computer with certain protocols that are specific to an `IAgent` implementation

member.name: P:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.IAgent.Identity
member.summary: The identity to use for requests. If null, then it will use the anonymous identity

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.IAgent.ReadStateAsync(EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.Principal,System.Collections.Generic.List{EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.StatePath})
member.summary: Gets the state of a specified canister with the subset of state information specified by the paths parameter
member.param: Canister to read state for
The state paths to get information for. Other state data will be pruned if not specified
member.returns: A response that contains the certificate of the current cansiter state

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.IAgent.GetRequestStatusAsync(EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.Principal,EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.RequestId)
member.summary: Gets the status of a request that is being processed by the specified canister
member.param: Canister where the request was sent to
Id of the request to get a status for
member.returns: A status variant of the request. If request is not found, will return null

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.IAgent.CallAsync(EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.Principal,System.String,EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.CandidArg,EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.Principal)
member.summary: Sends a call request to a specified canister method and gets back an id of the request that is being processed. This call does NOT wait for the request to be complete. Either check the status with `GetRequestStatusAsync` or use the `CallAndWaitAsync` method
member.param: Canister to read state for
The name of the method to call on the cansiter
The candid arg to send with the request
Optional. Specifies the relevant canister id if calling the root canister
member.returns: The id of the request that can be used to look up its status with `GetRequestStatusAsync`

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.IAgent.GetReplicaStatusAsync
member.summary: Gets the status of the IC replica. This includes versioning information about the replica
member.returns: A response containing all replica status information

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.IAgent.QueryAsync(EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.Principal,System.String,EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.CandidArg)
member.summary: Sends a query request to a specified canister method
member.param: Canister to read state for
The name of the method to call on the cansiter
The candid arg to send with the request
member.returns: The response data of the query call

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.IAgent.GetRootKeyAsync
member.summary: Gets the root public key of the current Internet Computer network
member.returns: The root public key bytes

member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.IAgentExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for the `IAgent` interface

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.IAgentExtensions.CallAndWaitAsync(EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Agents.IAgent,EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.Principal,System.String,EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.CandidArg,EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.Principal,System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken})
member.summary: Sends a call request to a specified canister method, waits for the request to be processed, the returns the candid response to the call. This is helper method built on top of `CallAsync` to wait for the response so it doesn't need to be implemented manually
member.param: The agent to use for the call
Canister to read state for
The name of the method to call on the cansiter
The candid arg to send with the request
Optional. Specifies the relevant canister id if calling the root canister
Optional. If specified, will be used to prematurely end the waiting
member.returns: The id of the request that can be used to look up its status with `GetRequestStatusAsync`

member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Identities.DelegationIdentity
member.summary:
An identity that has a signed delegation chain that authorizes the identity to act as another identity
This is commonly used for things like Internet Identity where a login session always generates a new key but that key has been signed by an authorized device through internet identity

member.name: P:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Identities.DelegationIdentity.Identity
member.summary: The identity that authorization has been delegated to

member.summary: The chain of singed delegations that prove authorization of the identity

The chain of singed delegations that prove authorization of the identity

member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Models.Certificate

member.summary: A partial state tree of the requested state data

member.summary: A signature on the tree root hash. Used to validate the tree

member.summary: Optional. A signed delegation that links a public key to the root public key

member.param: A partial state tree of the requested state data
A signature on the tree root hash. Used to validate the tree

member.exception: Throws if either `tree` or `signature` are null

member.returns: True if the certificate is valid, otherwise false

member.summary: Creates a byte array of the data that can be signed by an algorithm for authorization/signature purposes
member.returns: Byte array representation of the data

member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Models.DelegationChain
member.summary: A model containing a list of signed delegations to authorize an identity to act on behalf of the chain's public key

member.name: P:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Models.DelegationChain.PublicKey
member.summary: The public key of the identity that has delegated authority, DER encoded

summary.para:
The chain of delegations to authorize a key
Each delegation is signed by its parent key
The first delegation's parent is the root key (`PublicKey` in `DelegationChain`)
The last delegation is for the key to be authorized

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Models.DelegationChain.#ctor(EdjCase.ICP.Agent.SubjectPublicKeyInfo,System.Collections.Generic.List{EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Models.SignedDelegation})
member.param: The public key of the identity that has delegated authority, DER encoded
The chain of delegations to authorize a key

member.summary: Creates a delegation chain from the specified keys
member.param: The key to delegate authority to, DER encoded
The identity that is signing the delegation
How long to delegate for
Optional. List of canister ids to limit delegation to
Optional. List of pricipals where requests can originate from
member.returns: A delegation chain signed by the delegating identity

member.summary: The type of response returned. Can be used to call the right method to extract the variant data

member.summary: Gets the reply data IF the response type is 'rejected'. Otherwise will throw exception

member.summary: Helper method to either get the reply data or throw an exception that formats the 'rejected' data

member.summary: The variant options for a query response

member.summary: When the canister replies to a query request with no errors

member.summary: Fatal system error, retry unlikely to be useful

member.summary: Transient system error, retry might be possible

member.summary: Invalid destination (e.g. canister/account does not exist)

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.RejectCode.CanisterReject
member.summary: Explicit reject by the canister

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.RejectCode.CanisterError
member.summary: Canister error (e.g., trap, no response)

member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.RequestStatus
member.summary: A variant type of the status of a request that has been sent to a canister

member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.RequestStatus.StatusType
member.summary: The types of statuses the request can be

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.RequestStatus.StatusType.Received
member.summary: The request has been received by the node, but not yet being processed

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.RequestStatus.StatusType.Processing
member.summary: The request is being processed and does not have a response yet

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.RequestStatus.StatusType.Replied
member.summary: The request has been processed and it has reply data

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.RequestStatus.StatusType.Rejected
member.summary: The request has been processed and has reject data

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.RequestStatus.StatusType.Done
member.summary: The request has been processed but the response data has been removed. This usually happens after a certain amount of time to save space

member.name: P:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.RequestStatus.Type
member.summary: The type of status was returned

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.RequestStatus.AsReplied
member.summary: Returns the candid arg IF the status is 'replied', otherwise throws exception
member.returns: Candid arg of reply

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.RequestStatus.AsRejected
member.summary: Returns the reject data IF the status is 'rejected', otherwise throws exception
member.returns: Reject error information

member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.StatusResponse
member.summary: The model for response data from a status request

member.name: P:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.StatusResponse.ICApiVersion
member.summary: Identifies the interface version supported, i.e. the version of the present document that the internet computer aims to support, e.g. `0.8.1`. The implementation may also return unversioned to indicate that it does not comply to a particular version, e.g. in between releases.

member.name: P:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.StatusResponse.ImplementationSource
member.summary: Optional. Identifies the implementation of the Internet Computer Protocol, by convention with the canonical location of the source code (e.g. https://github.com/dfinity/ic).

member.name: P:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.StatusResponse.ImplementationVersion
member.summary: Optional. If the user is talking to a released version of an Internet Computer Protocol implementation, this is the version number. For non-released versions, output of git describe like `0.1.13-13-g2414721` would also be very suitable.

member.name: P:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.StatusResponse.ImplementationRevision
member.summary: Optional. The precise git revision of the Internet Computer Protocol implementation

member.name: P:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.StatusResponse.DevelopmentRootKey
member.summary: The public key (a DER-encoded BLS key) of the root key of this development instance of the Internet Computer Protocol. This must be present in short-lived development instances, to allow the agent to fetch the public key. For the Internet Computer, agents must have an independent trustworthy source for this data, and must not be tempted to fetch it from this insecure location.

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Responses.StatusResponse.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Byte[])
member.param: Identifies the interface version supported, i.e. the version of the present document that the internet computer aims to support, e.g. `0.8.1`. The implementation may also return unversioned to indicate that it does not comply to a particular version, e.g. in between releases.
Optional. Identifies the implementation of the Internet Computer Protocol, by convention with the canonical location of the source code (e.g. https://github.com/dfinity/ic).

Optional. If the user is talking to a released version of an Internet Computer Protocol implementation, this is the version number. For non-released versions, output of git describe like `0.1.13-13-g2414721` would also be very suitable.
Optional. The precise git revision of the Internet Computer Protocol implementation

The public key (a DER-encoded BLS key) of the root key of this development instance of the Internet Computer Protocol. This must be present in short-lived development instances, to allow the agent to fetch the public key. For the Internet Computer, agents must have an independent trustworthy source for this data, and must not be tempted to fetch it from this insecure location

member.summary: Returns the name of the token (e.g., MyToken).

member.summary: Returns the symbol of the token (e.g., ICP).

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.ICRC1Client.Decimals
member.summary: Returns the number of decimals the token uses (e.g., 8 means to divide the token amount by 100000000 to get its user representation).
member.returns: The number of decimals the token uses (e.g., 8 means to divide the token amount by 100000000 to get its user representation).

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.ICRC1Client.Fee
member.summary: Returns the default transfer fee.
member.returns: The default transfer fee.

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.ICRC1Client.TotalSupply
member.summary: Returns the total number of tokens on all accounts except for the minting account.
member.returns: The total number of tokens on all accounts except for the minting account.

member.name: M:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.ICRC1Client.MintingAccount

member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferErrorTag
member.summary: This enum represents the possible types of errors that can occur during a transfer

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferErrorTag.BadFee
member.summary: Indicates an error due to an incorrect fee

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferErrorTag.BadBurn
member.summary: Indicates an error due to an incorrect burn amount

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferErrorTag.InsufficientFunds
member.summary: Indicates an error due to insufficient funds for the transaction

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferErrorTag.TooOld
member.summary: Indicates an error due to a transaction being too old

member.summary: Indicates an error due to a transaction being created in the future

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferErrorTag.Duplicate
member.summary: Indicates an error due to a transaction being a duplicate

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferErrorTag.TemporarilyUnavailable
member.summary: Indicates that the service is temporarily unavailable

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferErrorTag.GenericError
member.summary: Indicates a generic error that can occur during a transfer

member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferResult
member.summary: Represents the result of a transfer operation, which can either be Ok with a value or Err with an error object

member.summary: The tag indicating whether the transfer operation was successful or resulted in an error

member.name: P:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferResult.Value
member.summary: The value of this TransferResult object, which can be either an UnboundedUInt or a TransferError object

member.summary: Private default constructor used for reflection

member.summary: Creates a new instance of TransferResult with the Ok tag and the given UnboundedUInt value

member.summary: Creates a new instance of TransferResult with the Err tag and the given TransferError object as the value
member.param: The TransferError object containing the error information

member.summary: Gets the value of this TransferResult object as an UnboundedUInt

member.summary: Gets the value of this TransferResult object as a TransferError object

member.summary: Throws an exception if the current tag of this TransferResult object does not match the given tag
member.param: The expected tag

member.name: T:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferResultTag
member.summary: An enumeration of possible tags for a TransferResult object, which can either be Ok with an UnboundedUInt value or Err with a TransferError object

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferResultTag.Ok
member.summary: Indicates a successful transfer operation with the associated UnboundedUInt value

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Agent.Standards.ICRC1.Models.TransferResultTag.Err
member.summary: Indicates a failed transfer operation with the associated TransferError object containing information about the error
